holidays.name: Celebrate Your Unique Talent Day
holidays.description: A day to embrace and showcase the quirky or unusual talents that make you one of a kind! Whether you can whistle through your nose or juggle spoons, today is your time to shine.
holidays.origin: This unofficial holiday emerged as a celebration of individuality and the diversity of human skills, encouraging people to appreciate what makes them unique.
holidays.funFact: There's even an online community where people share videos of their odd talents, from eyebrow dancing to speed stacking cups!

holidays.name: National Sardines Day
holidays.description: A fishy foodie celebration honoring the small but mighty sardine. Perfect for adventurous eaters, this day highlights sardinesâ€™ deliciousness and nutritional value.
holidays.origin: Observed in the United States, this food holiday promotes appreciation for sardines as a sustainable and healthy seafood option.
holidays.funFact: Sardines are often canned with their bones, making them an excellent source of calcium!

holidays.name: Buy Nothing Day (varies annually, often November 24)
holidays.description: A global day of protest against consumerism and overconsumptionâ€”people are encouraged to refrain from all shopping for 24 hours.
holidays.origin: Started in Canada in 1992, Buy Nothing Day has spread worldwide as a counterpoint to Black Fridayâ€™s shopping frenzy.
holidays.funFact: Some cities hold 'free markets' or clothing swaps on this day to promote sharing instead of buying.

holidays.name: Flossing Day
holidays.description: A humorous observance that reminds everyone to floss those pearly whitesâ€”because good dental hygiene is weirdly satisfying!
holidays.origin: Created by dental health advocates as a fun way to encourage flossing habits.
holidays.funFact: The average person only flosses 27% of recommended times; this day tries to boost those numbers with a fun twist!
